name: torus

torus noun [C]
(MATHEMATICS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
mathematics, science
  specialized a shape that is a circular tube that is hollow inside : A popular shape for space stations is the doughnut shape, also called a torus. You can compare the torus to an inflatable lifebelt.
More examplesFewer examplesThis is a view inside the central chamber - or torus - of the Joint European Torus project for fusion energy. When the magnetic field and the solar wind collide, the Van Allen radiation belts are formed - a pair of concentric, torus-shaped regions of energetic charged particles.

torus noun [C]
(ON COLUMN)
architecture
  specialized a rounded part at the base of a column above the plinth (= the square block on which the column stands): The torus can be seen in Egyptian, Greek, and Roman style pillars. The base consists of a plinth below a torus which joins the plinth at right angles.

torus noun [C]
(ON BODY)
anatomy, medical
  specialized a rounded piece of bone that sticks out from a surface in the body: The hard bumps that you can feel in your mouth are most likely harmless growths of extra bone called tori. In these apes the torus above the eyes is well developed.
